Christian Tomasi <chrtom1979@...> wrote:   Hi Ricky,

the first problem I have is while executing "configure" command. It seems that 
it can't find Matlab in my system (matlab script is in the 
directory: /usr/local/matlab7/bin):

--------------------------------------------------------------
           Cantera Configuration Script
--------------------------------------------------------------
Cantera will be installed in /usr/local
checking build system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking host system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking target system type... i686-pc-linux-gnu
checking for python2... no
checking for python... /usr/bin/python
Python command set by configure to  /usr/bin/python
checking for matlab... none
checking for a BSD-compatible install... /usr/bin/install -c
checking for C++ compiler default output... a.out

checking whether we are cross compiling... no

checking for suffix of object files... o

checking for sstream... yes

config.status: creating ../config.h
---------------------------------------------------------------------


Have I to modify cantera configure script? and how in this case?
Or simply have I to create a matlab script link where cantera can find it? 
Where? (I have tried in /usr/local/bin, but it doesn't work...)

If I try to execute "make" command anyway, it gives me the following error 
message: 

make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/christian/cantera/Cantera/fortran/src'
/usr/bin/install -c Cantera/fortran/src/*.mod build/include/cantera
cd Cantera/python; make
make[1]: Entering directory `/home/christian/cantera/Cantera/python'
touch src/pycantera.cpp
(CXX=g++; export CXX; CC=gcc; export CC; /usr/bin/python setup.py build)
could not import distutils. Will try anyway...
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 96, in ?
    raise 'Error encountered while building or installing the Cantera CTI file 
p
Error encountered while building or installing the Cantera CTI file 
preprocessor
make[1]: *** [_build] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/christian/cantera/Cantera/python'
make: *** [python] Error 2
linux:/home/christian/cantera #

I don't know if this is due to the lack of some packages...I can't find 
"sundials" as you have suggested me. 
I have noticed that in the cantera "readme" file they say that gcc,g++,g77 are 
needed. I haven't found g++ package too.
I'm sorry about my poor knowledges about linux, but I have passed only 
recently to this system...Thank you very much for your help. 

Christian




>  Hi Christian,
>
>  The instalation directory is unlikely the reason of the error. It looks
>  like you have the error when installing. Is cantera successfully built?
>  Check the   message again when you type 'make'.
>
>  Make sure there is matlab script links in /usr/local/bin or whereever
>  cantera can find. Also, you probably need sundials to build cantera.
>
>  Good Luck
>
>  Li-Chun Chien (Ricky)
>  Combustion Modelling Lab
>  University of California, Berkeley
